RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Graduated in Medicine from the Federal University of Pernambuco (1978), she completed an Internship in Internal Medicine at Hospital Barгo de Lucena (INAMPS) in 1978 and a Medical Residency in Psychiatry at Hospital Pedro Segundo between 1979 and 1980. Specialist in Social Sciences Applied to Health (1981) and in Public Health (1983) from the National School of Public Health (FIOCRUZ) and in International Health Administration from Georgia State University in 1988. Master of Science in Epidemiology (1990-1991) and PhD in Epidemiology from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, England (1994 - 1998). In 2009, she did a postdoc at the University of Bristol, England.Participated in the extension project Public Health in Northeast Brazil: The Pernambuco Experience, developed between 1998 and 2000 by the NUSP/UFPE Public Health and Social Development Center, Pernambuco Health Department and the Japan International Cooperation Agency JICA. As part of the activities, she conducted training in Japan in October 1999 with a JICA scholarship.I started my teaching career in 1998 at UFPE, performing my activities in the Department of Social Medicine and in the Graduate Program in Collective Health, where I have been a full professor since 2016. I was coordinator and deputy of the program. In addition, I am part of the Graduate Program in Child and Adolescent Health at UFPE.Since then, in addition to teaching classes and guiding graduate students, I have been developing research in the areas of Mental Health and Consequences of Violence committed by an intimate partner for the health of women and their children, whose results were published in the Lancet, British Journal of Psychiatry , Social Science and Medicine, Health Policy and Planning, among other excellent scientific journals.In 1999, I participated as a senior researcher in the research WHO multi-country study on women's health and domestic violence against women, coordinated by Professor Lilia Blima Schraiber of the Department of Preventive Medicine of the Faculty of Medicine of the University of Sгo Paulo, financed by the World Health Organization. Health.Since 2004 I have been coordinating the cohort study Consequences of violence committed by an intimate partner during pregnancy, in the postpartum period and in the last seven years for women's health and for the psychosocial development of the child resulting from pregnancy, developed in three stages financed by CNPq, which brought together researchers from the Graduate Programs in Collective Health and Child and Adolescent Health at the Federal University of Pernambuco, in addition to the Center for Child and Adolescent Health at the University of Bristol.I participated in the Epidemiology Committee of the Brazilian Association of Graduate Studies in Collective Health, between 2002 and 2010, and chaired the VI Brazilian Congress of Epidemiology.I participated in the risk assessment cohort study of health professionals who cared for people with COVID-19, in relation to the degree of exposure and use of personal protective equipment (PPE), in the epidemic and post-epidemic period. The study evaluated the mental health situation of these professionals and estimated the prevalence and incidence of COVID-19 by category of health professionals in different care sectors, in the epidemic and post-epidemic period.I was a research productivity fellow PQ 2005-2018, being PQ1D between 2008-2015.
